results.title: Diabolique
results.creator_credit: Jerremiah Chechik, James G. Robinson, Marvin Worth and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Jeremiah Chechik’s remake of the French classic, “Les Diaboliques” by Henri-Georges Clouzot, didn’t quite receive the acclaim of the original. Sharon Stone and Isabelle Adjani star as Nicole and Mia, the long suffering lover and wife of the cruel and manipulative headmaster Guy (Chazz Palminteri). Nicole is angry at being taken for granted and Mia, who suffers from a heart problem, is suicidal over her husband’s infidelity. Together they devise a foolproof scheme to rid their lives of Guy and all seems to have gone to plan until events occur that indicate Guy has survived. Hot on his tail is a disgruntled cop, Kathy Bates, who is sympathetic to the women’s situation but also eager to discover the truth.

results.title: Victim
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Parkway Films
results.brief_description: Dirk Bogarde stars as Melville Farr, a successful lawyer in this film which caused a sensation at its original release. Farr is approached by police who are looking into the theft of money they suspect is being used as payment for blackmail by Jack Barrett (Peter McEnery). Farr initially denies knowing about Barrett because of their previous homosexual relations. Barrett eventually chooses suicide over disclosing the affair and Farr guiltily takes a personal interest in locating the blackmailer. He discovers that Barrett was not the only one being blackmailed, and Barrett must decide between exposing his homosexuality and threatening his career or challenging the legal system that decreed homosexuality a criminal offence and bringing Barrett’s blackmailers to justice. Screenplay by Janet Green and John McCormick. Cast also includes Sylvia Syms, Dennis Price, Anthony Nicholls and Peter McEnery.

results.title: The Card
results.creator_credit: Ronald Neame, Clive Donner, John Bryan and British Film-Makers Limited
results.brief_description: Edward Henry Machin (Alec Guinness), Denry for short, has been determined from youth to master his own fate. He uses his powers of persuasion and deception to cajole his way to fame and fortune, but still manages to remain friends with everyone. Affectionately known as ‘The Card’, Denry’s ultimate coup occurs when he becomes the youngest mayor of his home town of Bursley. Denry is not without female companionship, and his life is influenced by three women; a Countess, a dancing teacher, and the councillor’s daughter. It is through his relationship with these women that his deceptive ways are exposed. Also starring Glynis Johns, Valerie Hobson and Petula Clark. Based on the novel by Arnold Bennett and screenplay by Eric Ambler. Also known as “The Promoter”.

results.title: Rambling Rose
results.creator_credit: Martha Coolidge, Renny Harlin and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: The traditional Southern values of the upstanding Hillyer family are about to be challenged. They’ve just hired a 19-year-old Rose (Laura Dern) as a housekeeper and nanny, unaware of the hilarious disruptions her arrival will cause. The very sweet and kind Rose has uncontrollable sexual impulses which cause her to ramble from man to man, bed to bed, leaving a trail of catastrophes in her wake.

results.title: Breaking the waves
results.creator_credit: Lars Von Trier, Peter Aalbaek Jensen, Vibeke Windelov, La Sept Cinema and Zentropa Entertainments
results.brief_description: A moving portrayal of Bess, a devout, innocent woman who lives in an isolated Scottish fishing village. The warmth and love she has found in her marriage to oil-rig worker Jan is shattered by an accident that leaves him paralysed from the neck down. When he encourages Bess to have sex with other men, she is propelled into a personal and religious crisis that the claustrophobic and repressive community of the village only makes worse. The visual style of the film evokes a fly-on-the-wall, documentary feel achieved by Muellers hand-held camerawork. Beyond this filming technique, the wide-screen stock was put through a film-video-film transfer process, muting the colour and producing noticeable grain. Emily Watson won Berlin Film Festival and New York Critics Circle Best Actress awards, and was nominated for an oscar for her finely articulated performance of a woman made victim to the desires and dictates of the men around her. The film won the Grand Jury Prize at Cannes in 1996. Cast includes Emily Watson, Stellan Skarsgard, Katrin Cartlidge, Jean-Marc Barr, Adrian Rawlins and Sandra Voe.

results.title: Night falls on Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Josh Kramer, Thom Mount and Spelling Films
results.brief_description: Sean Casey (Andy Garcia), a cop turned lawyer is landed the coveted position of D.A. when he wins a highly publicised case that resulted in the death of 3 police officers and the serious wounding of Casey’s father, also a policeman. The case is marked by dirty cops and corruption and as Casey begins his new appointment he discovers that truth was not really the victor during the trail, but was justice and honesty served? Casey must decide on a balance between the confusing concepts of truth, honesty, justice, loyalty and morality. Based on the novel, “Tainted evidence” by Robert Daley. Cast also includes Ian Holm, Lena Olin and Paul Guilfoyle.

results.title: Big night
results.creator_credit: Campbell Scott, Stanley Tucci, Jonathan Filley, Rysher Entertainment and Timpano Productions
results.brief_description: A treat for movie and food lovers everywhere, this multi-award winning comedy tells the story of two Italian brothers (Primo and Secondo), whose superb restaurant is on the brink of bankruptcy. Their only chance is to risk everything they own on one big night where they invite local identities and band leader Louis Prima to a six course, twenty-two dish feast that will either make or break them. Cast includes Ian Holm, Tony Shalhoub, Stanley Tucci, Isabella Rossellini and Minnie Driver.

results.title: Johnny Mnemonic
results.creator_credit: Robert Longo, Don Carmody and ANM
results.brief_description: A snapshot of the future, the year 2021. Corporations rule and the world is threatened by a new plague, NAS; Nerve Attenuation Syndrome. To protect data it must be smuggled through mnemonic carriers who carry the data through a computer chip implanted into the brain; Johnny Mnemonic (Keanu Reeves) is one such carrier. Johnny’s present mission is to carry data from two scientists who have defected from one of the world’s largest corporations, taking the information from Japan to America. The upload of information carried in Johnny’s brain surpasses anything he has carried before and he must find the secret access code that will allow him to download the information, otherwise he will die. Also starring Dolph Lundgren, Takeshi Kitano, Ice-T and Dina Meyer.

results.title: Donnie Brasco [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Barry Levinson, Gail Mutrux, Louis Digiamo, Mark Johnson and Mandalay Entertainment
results.brief_description: This is a gangster movie quite like no other which is more concerned with character study, friendship and betrayal. Donnie Brasco (Johnny Depp), also known as Joe the Jeweller, befriends Mafia small man and former assassin Lefty Ruggiero (Al Pacino). Lefty sees in the young Donnie a chance to rise in the Mafia ranks, something the aging Lefty, with his drug addicted son and passive wife is no longer capable of. Unbeknown to Lefty, Donnie Brasco is an under cover special agent, working with the FBI to infiltrate the New York Mafia underworld. What at first seems a simple case of undercover work is complicated by Donnie’s genuine feelings of friendship towards Lefty and Lefty’s loyalty towards Donnie. Based on the book by Joseph D. Pistone with Richard Woodley. Also starring Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby, James Russo and Anne Heche.

results.title: Shadowlands
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Brian Eastman and Spelling Films International
results.brief_description:
Shadowlands is an absorbing and moving story of true love. British writer C. S. Lewis, whose comfortable but rigid life as an Oxford don in the 1950’s is shaken by his meeting with a forthright poet, American Joy Gresham. She knew him from his books and he remembered her from her letters, but when they finally met, she was unlike any-one he had ever known. Like his writings, his love for Joy is captivating and magical. A story for everyone, made with uncommon intelligence and restraint.
Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger and Julian Fellowes
